meanings.definition: The eldest son of the king of France, used as a title.
meanings.sent1: The dauphins was next in line to the throne.
meanings.sent2: The dauphins attended royal events with his father.
meanings.sent3: The dauphins tried on the crown for fun.
meanings.sent4: The dauphins carried the weight of royal expectations.
meanings.sent5: The dauphins' presence commanded respect in the court.

meanings.definition: A type of dolphin found in the Mediterranean Sea.
meanings.sent1: We spotted dauphins swimming gracefully in the sea.
meanings.sent2: Dauphins are known for their playful nature.
meanings.sent3: The dauphins put on a synchronized swimming show.
meanings.sent4: The dauphins' sleek bodies glided through the water effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The dauphins' clicks and whistles echoed in the ocean depths.

meanings.sent1: The bakery displayed freshly baked dauphins on the shelves.
meanings.sent2: I savored the sweet taste of the dauphins.
meanings.sent3: The dauphins pastry melted in my mouth.
meanings.sent4: The dauphins were as light as a feather.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the dauphins filled the kitchen with delight.
